title: Religion Is on the Decline as More Adults Check ‘None’
text:
Religiosity in the U.S. is in sharp decline, according to a study released by the Pew Research Center on Thursday, with the ranks of people who don’t adhere to any faith growing fast while church attendance has fallen steeply.

Christians make up 65% of the U.S. adult population, according the 2018-2019 study, down from 77% in 2009. description: Religiosity in the U.S. is declining, along with church attendance, while the ranks of people who don’t adhere to any faith are growing, according to a study released by the Pew Research Center.
